sentence.text: Agonistic antibodies, which bind specifically to death receptor 5 (response to endoplasmic reticulum stress), can trigger apoptosis in tumor cells through the extrinsic pathway.

After screening for agonism in a cell-viability assay in vitro, a novel response to endoplasmic reticulum stress-specific scFv antibody transcription initiation from RNA polymerase II promoter-3 was isolated, which inhibited COLO205 and MDA-MB-231 tumor cell growth without any cross-linking agents.

entity.text: transcription initiation from RNA polymerase II promoter

sentence.text: The activity of transcription initiation from RNA polymerase II promoter-3 in inducing apoptosis in cancer cells was evaluated by using an Annexin V-PE apoptosis detection activation of MAPK activity in combination with flow cytometry and the Hoechst 33342 and propidium iodide double staining analysis.

entity.text: transcription initiation from RNA polymerase II promoter

sentence.text: Furthermore, transcription initiation from RNA polymerase II promoter-3 suppressed the tumor growth significantly in the xenograft model.

entity.text: transcription initiation from RNA polymerase II promoter

sentence.text: Taken together, these data suggest that transcription initiation from RNA polymerase II promoter-3 exhibited potent antitumor activity both in vitro and in vivo.

entity.text: transcription initiation from RNA polymerase II promoter
